item.title: フンケ・メディアグループ、AIが生成したミハエル・シューマッハのインタビューを掲載したドイツ誌「Die Aktuelle」の編集者を解雇（Alan Baldwin/Reuters)
item.description:
Alan Baldwin / Reuters:
Funke media group sacks the editor of German magazine Die Aktuelle, which published an AI-generated interview with Michael Schumacher  —  The publishers of a German magazine that ran an ‘interview’ with Michael Schumacher generated by artificial intelligence have sacked the editor and apologised to the Formula One great's family.

item.title: CNN、ゲイル・キングとチャールズ・バークレーがホストを務めるゴールデンタイムの週刊番組「King Charles」を発表、2023年秋に開始予定で水曜放送（Brian Steinberg/Variety）
item.description:
Brian Steinberg / Variety:
CNN announces King Charles, a weekly primetime program with hosts Gayle King and Charles Barkley, expected to launch in fall 2023 and air on Wednesdays  —  Gayle King and Charles Barkley will help break traditional barriers around news programming later this year when they launch “King Charles,” a new weekly primetime program for CNN.

item.title: UpworkのようなマーケットプレイスでAIが生成したコンテンツが普及することで、取引上の紛争が発生し、クライアントとフリーランサーの不信感が高まっている（Rashi Shrivastava/Forbes）
item.description:
Rashi Shrivastava / Forbes:
The proliferation of AI-generated content on marketplaces like Upwork is causing transactional disputes and increasing mistrust between clients and freelancers  —  While some freelancers are losing their gigs to ChatGPT, clients are being spammed with AI-written content on freelancing platforms.

item.title: CPJ：エヴァン・ガーシュコビッチの前に、2022年に30カ国以上で363人のジャーナリストが拘束された、RSFの2022年報道自由度指数：ロシアは180カ国中155位（ウォール・ストリート・ジャーナル紙）
item.description:
Wall Street Journal:
The CPJ: 363 journalists were detained in 30+ countries in 2022, before Evan Gershkovich; RSF's 2022 press-freedom index: Russia ranked 155 out of 180 countries  —  'It's gotten worse everywhere,' the Committee to Protect Journalists says about press freedom

item.title: ファイリングしています：パラマウント・グローバルの取締役は、2019年のCBSとバイアコムの合併をめぐるCBS投資家の訴訟について、別の122.5Mドルの合意に続き、167.5Mドルの和解に合意（Jef Feeley/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Jef Feeley / Bloomberg:
Filing: Paramount Global directors agree to a $167.5M settlement of CBS investors' lawsuits over the 2019 CBS-Viacom merger, following a separate $122.5M accord  —  Paramount Global directors agreed to a $167.5 million settlement of investors' lawsuits over the controversial 2019 merger …

item.title: ケーブルテレビの盛衰に伴うスポーツメディアの権利金について、リーグやフランチャイズがケーブルのピーク時のリーチと収益を再現できないと心配する理由（Ben Strauss/Washington Post)
item.description:
Ben Strauss / Washington Post:
A look at sports media rights money with cable TV's rise and fall, and why leagues and franchises worry they won't replicate the reach and revenue of peak cable  —  Television has changed the course of sports as long as it has existed, in ways both sweeping and specific.

item.description:
Reuters Institute:
Highlights from talks at International Journalism Festival 2023 in Perugia, Italy, about reporting in exile, investigative journalism, generative AI, and more  —  Here are a few highlights from the festival on topics such as press freedom, investigative journalism, climate coverage and AI

Alastair Reid / @ajreid:
[Thread] At the International Journalism Festival in Perugia, Italy, journalists debate the shifting value of social networks, especially Twitter and Facebook  —  Outrageous setting for this powerhouse panel here at #ijf23 with @CharlieBeckett @emilybell @mathewi and @mitrakalita. item.title: 情報筋の話：Twitter、ロシア・中国・イランの政府アカウントや国家系メディアに対する「可視化フィルタリング・ルール」、すなわち「シャドーバン」を削除（Dara Kerr/NPR）
item.description:
Dara Kerr / NPR:
Sources: Twitter removed its “visibility filtering rules”, or “shadow bans”, for Russian, Chinese, and Iranian government accounts and state-affiliated media  —  Dmitry Medvedev, a leading government official and former president of Russia, took to Twitter earlier …

item.title: Bloomberg Media、2023年第2四半期にドキュメンタリーやインタビュー形式を中心とした6つの新番組を発表、IPパートナーシップの責任者にCassie Thorntonを採用（Alex Weprin/The Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Alex Weprin / The Hollywood Reporter:
Bloomberg Media announces six new shows, focusing on documentary or interview formats, for Q2 2023, and hires Cassie Thornton as its head of IP partnerships  —  The new head of IP, Cassie Thornton, will be tasked with striking licensing deals to bring Bloomberg's journalism to other platforms.

item.title: 米控訴裁判所は、スタンダード・ジェネラルが提案したテレビ放送局テグナの54億ドルの買収を承認するか否かの決定を早めるようFCCに強制することを断念した（Todd Shields/Bloomberg Law）。
item.description:
Todd Shields / Bloomberg Law:
A US appeals court declines to force the FCC to speed up its decision to approve or deny Standard General's proposed $5.4B acquisition of TV broadcaster Tegna  —  Share To:  —  A court declined to speed regulatory consideration of Standard General LP's proposed purchase of TV broadcaster Tegna Inc. …

item.title: BuzzFeedのCEOであるジョナ・ペレッティは、BuzzFeed Newsに革新をもたらし、他の人よりも長く続けてきたが、Facebookのニュースからのピボットによって、彼の創造物は消滅してしまった（Hillary Frey/Slate)
item.description:
Hillary Frey / Slate:
BuzzFeed CEO Jonah Peretti innovated and kept BuzzFeed News going longer than others would have, only for Facebook's pivot away from news to kill his creation  —  I heard about BuzzFeed News shutting down right before it hit Twitter.  Word travels fast among industry old-timers like myself, and we try to keep each other in the loop.

item.title: ニュースレターやキュレーションを利用してSNS上のユーザーやライターを巻き込むLinkedInを利用したビジネスジャーナリストのオーディエンス構築方法（Charlotte Tobitt/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Charlotte Tobitt / Press Gazette:
How business journalists are building their audiences via LinkedIn, which is using newsletters and curation to engage users and writers on the social network  —  Linkedin has one of the biggest business newsrooms in the world, with more than 250 editors following a major expansion in the past year.

item.title: 香港のジャーナリストたちは、かつてApple Dailyのような閉鎖された出版社で働いていたが、中国の法律にもかかわらず、独立してメディアを作り続けている（Hsiuwen Liu/Columbia Journalism Review）。
item.description:
Hsiuwen Liu / Columbia Journalism Review:
Journalists in Hong Kong, many who once worked at outlets that have since closed, like Apple Daily, continue to produce media independently despite China's laws  —  Hong Kong Court News, an online outlet that debuted at the start of the year, operates out of a rented coworking space in Wong Chuk Hang …

item.title: 情報筋の話：Hasbroは、プライベート・エクイティ会社CVCが支援するEntertainment Oneの創業者Darren Throopに、EOneの資産の大半を売り戻すよう交渉している（Bloomberg）。
item.description:
Bloomberg:
Sources: Hasbro is in talks with Entertainment One founder Darren Throop, who is backed by private equity firm CVC, to sell him back most of EOne's assets  —  Hasbro Inc. is in talks with Entertainment One founder Darren Throop to sell most of the film and TV studio's assets back to him, according to people familiar with the matter.
